instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.ISL9240: What is ISL9240? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2018 through 2020.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging but works great otherwise.
threads.message:
No charge voltage present.
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H</SIGNAL> is good.
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> voltage all the way up to 12v at <TRANSISTOR>Q7065</TRANSISTOR>
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> has power and <RESISTOR>R7061</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7062</RESISTOR> are both reading properly at 1ohm.
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is present

No sign of water damage.

Is <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> still made out of unobtanium?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging but works great otherwise.
threads.message: <CHIP>ISL9240</CHIP> is Apple proprietary chip; no way to get it new.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging but works great otherwise.
threads.message: see-ic has some chips pulled from boards, but it's expensive. Try to get donor boards with the chip still on them.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging but works great otherwise.
threads.message:
What is the voltage at F7000/1 with battery alone (no charger)?
Is the battery recognized in macOS?

0V at <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> is required when charging battery.
Did you try known good battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging but works great otherwise.
threads.message: It was the ISL chip.  I replaced it and the machine works fine.
